{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3428162,"name":"Owen Flanagan","username":"OwenF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/edb3f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-26T23:13:40.353Z","cooked":"

My team has been throwing around the idea of detecting and predicting the movements of other robots to allow our automation to avoid them. I have been trying to figure out how to write a path planner that can avoid these paths and it seems very possible but I can’t for the life of me figure out how. I have done quite a bit of googling but found nothing so either there is nothing or I’m just using the wrong words and missing it. Does anyone know how to do something like this or even where to look?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-09-26T23:13:40.353Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":212,"reads":443,"readers_count":442,"score":1163.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":472007,"topic_slug":"automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths","display_username":"Owen Flanagan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65469,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Code Lead"},"post_url":"/t/automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths/472007/1","custom_user_title":"Code Lead","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3428166,"name":"","username":"Nimble","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/a5b964/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-26T23:27:52.074Z","cooked":"

How exactly do you want to approach this? Pathplanner itself is not enough, do you have a vision system or some sort of depth sensor? Object detection could be combined with photo vision in the fly trajectory generation.

","post_number":2,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-09-26T23:27:52.074Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":19,"reads":430,"readers_count":429,"score":201.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":472007,"topic_slug":"automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56803,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths/472007/2","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3428168,"name":"Yishai Levy","username":"levyishai","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/levyishai/{size}/264719_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-26T23:32:36.361Z","cooked":"

If you theoretically have a way to detect the 3d position of robots on the field, you could use dynamic obstacles.

","post_number":3,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-09-26T23:32:51.266Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":411,"readers_count":410,"score":132.2,"yours":false,"topic_id":472007,"topic_slug":"automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths","display_username":"Yishai Levy","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://pathplanner.dev/api/java/com/pathplanner/lib/pathfinding/Pathfinding.html#setDynamicObstacles(java.util.List,edu.wpi.first.math.geometry.Translation2d)","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Pathfinding (pathplannerlib API)","clicks":104}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57809,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team Captain, Programming Lead & Operator"},"post_url":"/t/automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths/472007/3","custom_user_title":"Team Captain, Programming Lead & Operator","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3428170,"name":"Owen Flanagan","username":"OwenF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/edb3f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-26T23:43:03.742Z","cooked":"

The issue with dynamic obstacles is that we can only avoid where the robot is at generation(unless I really misunderstand how they work). Since robots move constantly there is a good chance that by the time the path is carried out the avoidance will be unnecessary. This is why we have people looking into a prediction algorithm(since in the last few games robot paths have been very repetitive). However we need a way to avoid the predicted path which has been my struggle.

","post_number":4,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-09-26T23:43:03.742Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":3,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":394,"readers_count":393,"score":88.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":472007,"topic_slug":"automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths","display_username":"Owen Flanagan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":57809,"username":"levyishai","name":"Yishai Levy","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/levyishai/{size}/264719_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65469,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Code Lead"},"post_url":"/t/automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths/472007/4","custom_user_title":"Code Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3428171,"name":"Owen Flanagan","username":"OwenF","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/edb3f5/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-26T23:44:47.674Z","cooked":"

isn’t photon vision just a camera and positioning software or does it also have trajectory stuff I missed(and if so where is it)?

","post_number":5,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-09-26T23:44:47.674Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":2,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":354,"readers_count":353,"score":85.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":472007,"topic_slug":"automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths","display_username":"Owen Flanagan","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"reply_to_user":{"id":56803,"username":"Nimble","name":"","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/a5b964/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":65469,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Code Lead"},"post_url":"/t/automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths/472007/5","custom_user_title":"Code Lead","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3428174,"name":"Yishai Levy","username":"levyishai","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/levyishai/{size}/264719_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-26T23:59:12.505Z","cooked":"
OwenF:

unless I really misunderstand how they work

Yeah, I don’t think that’s how that works.
Looking at this GIF for example, it seems like it changes on the fly.

PathPlanner 2024 Beta Programming
Found a fix. Here’s a GIF of it. It doesn’t seem to be as weird as it used to be but there are still some issues that can pop up. Biggest one now seems to be that you can get some pretty hard accelerations when the path switches directions around an obstacle. It keeps its speed and just changes heading instantly. This is probably something that can be fixed with replanning but that’s a different problem I can look at later. [Robot Simulation 2023-10-14 21-20-42]
","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-09-26T23:59:12.505Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":4,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":3,"reads":327,"readers_count":326,"score":85.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":472007,"topic_slug":"automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths","display_username":"Yishai Levy","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.chiefdelphi.com/t/pathplanner-2024-beta/442364/57","internal":true,"reflection":false,"title":"PathPlanner 2024 Beta","clicks":0}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":57809,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Team Captain, Programming Lead & Operator"},"post_url":"/t/automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths/472007/6","custom_user_title":"Team Captain, Programming Lead & Operator","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3428176,"name":"Geoffrey","username":"Geoffrey8814","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/geoffrey8814/{size}/262430_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-27T00:00:56.653Z","cooked":"

I suggest considering a nonlinear model predictive control (MPC), but I believe using a neural network is the best approach. Due to the complexity of the FRC system, a path generator may not be able to keep up with changes. We are developing a self-driving robot using imitation learning, trained on our driver inputs. Additionally, we are exploring advanced methods such as implementing a transformer or a recurrent neural network (RNN) to give our system memory.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-09-27T00:02:53.029Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":8,"reads":295,"readers_count":294,"score":119.0,"yours":false,"topic_id":472007,"topic_slug":"automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths","display_username":"Geoffrey","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":60663,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths/472007/7","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3428185,"name":"","username":"Nimble","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/n/a5b964/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-27T00:28:11.520Z","cooked":"

Photonvision is for vision, to use a rknn model that they support you need to run it on an orange pi. This allows for object detection, you have to manually add in a robot detection model though. There’s a tutorial floating around in how to train a rknn model from an annotation device like roboflow or you could find a pre trained model.

","post_number":8,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-09-27T00:28:11.520Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":5,"reads":268,"readers_count":267,"score":78.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":472007,"topic_slug":"automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths","display_username":"","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":65469,"username":"OwenF","name":"Owen Flanagan","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/o/edb3f5/{size}.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":56803,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths/472007/8","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3428187,"name":"Max Morehead","username":"Max_Morehead","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/max_morehead/{size}/231937_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-27T00:36:57.635Z","cooked":"

Dynamically tracking other robots the field, mapping them in 3d space, predicting their trajectory, and smoothly and seamlessly avoiding them is quite a hard problem. Especially that last part, because it might involve making strategic decisions, and it’s hard to beat the best strategic decision making machine on Earth (for now), the human brain.

What hardware and resources do you have available for the project? What vision and sensing experience does your team have? Have you previously successfully used full field odometry?

Purely for the problem of avoiding obstacles with known locations, when you know your own location, I’d start with: Pathfinding | PathPlanner Docs

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-09-27T00:36:57.635Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":4,"reads":257,"readers_count":256,"score":101.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":472007,"topic_slug":"automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths","display_username":"Max Morehead","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://pathplanner.dev/pplib-pathfinding.html","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Pathfinding | PathPlanner Docs","clicks":4}],"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":2}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53784,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths/472007/9","custom_user_title":"Mentor","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":2}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":2,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3428226,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-27T03:10:53.468Z","cooked":"

Lots of good input here.

I’d suggest a bit of a counterpoint, though. Sometimes the FRC field is pretty open, and it could be that you don’t need to solve the whole hard problem folks are talking about. Maybe what you really need is a little help for the driver: “don’t hit the big red thing” that nudges the joysticks a little for them. I’d suggest experimenting with concrete and simple things like that, they might go further than you’d expect.

Different April Tags on robots would be cool

","post_number":11,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-09-27T03:51:18.897Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":194,"readers_count":193,"score":63.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":472007,"topic_slug":"automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths","display_username":"sanddrag","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":1}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":1082,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths/472007/11","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":1}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":1,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3428235,"name":"joel truher","username":"truher","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/truher/{size}/172222_2.png","created_at":"2024-09-27T03:59:30.351Z","cooked":"

note it is entirely legal to ask your alliance mates to decorate their robots with “friend or foe” apriltags, as long as they’re not the same type (36h11) as the field tags.

","post_number":12,"post_type":1,"posts_count":17,"updated_at":"2024-09-27T03:59:30.351Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":182,"readers_count":181,"score":86.4,"yours":false,"topic_id":472007,"topic_slug":"automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths","display_username":"joel truher","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":null,"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":3}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":53190,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":""},"post_url":"/t/automatically-avoiding-other-robots-paths/472007/12","custom_user_title":null,"reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":3}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":3,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3428244,"name":"sam liu","username":"catrix","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/c/dbc845/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-09-27T04:34:42.511Z","cooked":"

Firstly, I admire what you are working on; it sounds like the coolest thing that programmers have ever done throughout the history of FRC.
However, it’s going to be insanely hard. The “fully autopiloted robot” is the ultimate challenge of FRC. Many teams have attempted it, and 3015 made some awe-inspiring progress this year, but they are still far from the goal. I would say that we are 5-10 years away from achieving it.

I believe there are two approaches to consider: mathematical modeling and machine learning. Path planning or Model Predictive Control (MPC) is usually based on a physics model created by programmers. However, when you have to program it yourself, you need to take into account all the factors that can influence the model. For instance, you can use a path planner to generate a path that avoids obstacles, but what if the object is in motion? Then, you would need a more complex model. Moreover, what if you want to generate a different path based on whether the object is your alliance partner or not? Or if their path is not linear, or if you want to determine whether they are playing defense or not? It is almost impossible for programmers to consider all the possible scenarios. I think that even though machine learning may seem difficult initially, it will be easier in the long run. Furthermore, traditional technologies like LIDAR and RADAR are being supplanted by machine learning models such as depth estimation and object detection. I believe this shift represents a growing trend in which traditional algorithms are being replaced by ML algorithms, especially as GPU and NPU capabilities continue to advance.

most autons follow a similar path, as long as the team isnt making dynamic paths that follow game pieces. you might be able to get away with just having options in your robot’s auton that avoid common paths for other starting positions. obviously this would only work in a game where the starting positions and auto paths are predictable (eg crescendo)

if you still wanna go down the CV path, maybe take a look at methods of tracking fast moving objects with opencv/similar. robots are the only thing on the field anyway, so you could just work to avoid anything moving quickly nearby. previously i had messed with this project, might be worth looking into: GitHub - rozumden/fmo-cpp-demo: Fast Moving Objects Detection (demo version)

I’ve been looking the Stereolabs ZED camera, the SKD looks like the software and sensor stack has positional tracking inside the SDK which enabled object avoidance.

stereolabs.com

ZED 2 - AI Stereo Camera | Stereolabs

The ZED 2 family is a next-generation series of USB 3.1 stereo cameras that seamlessly integrate advanced depth sensing with AI capabilities. This combination empowers you to develop cutting-edge spatial intelligence applications.

stereolabs.com

Positional Tracking Use Cases - Stereolabs

Robotics # Intelligent cars, drones and robots need to perceive and understand their environment. They must operate in previously unknown and unstructured environments, where reliable external methods …

Overall I’d say being able to detect other robots and avoid them autonomously is a higher level capability that, depending on the game, a capability that levels up a teams capabilities.
